labels.analysis: The MCP Server "4o-image Image Generation Server" is primarily focused on generating and editing high-quality images based on text prompts. It allows users to create new art, 3D characters, and custom visuals, or modify existing images. The real-time progress updates and automatic browser opening for immediate viewing suggest a user-friendly, visually oriented tool designed for artistic or creative purposes.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Content Creation" is chosen because the server's core functionality revolves around generating and editing visual content. The secondary label "AI/ML Tools" is selected as it likely employs machine learning models for image generation. No custom label is needed as the predefined labels adequately cover the server's functionality.

server_info_crawled.name: 4o-image Image Generation Server
server_info_crawled.author: @Antipas/mcp-4oimage
server_info_crawled.overview: Generate and edit high-quality images using simple text prompts. Transform existing images or create new art, 3D characters, and custom visuals with real-time progress updates. Automatically open generated images in your browser for immediate viewing.

tools.name: generateImage
tools.description: Deploy Server 4o-image Image Generation Server @Antipas/mcp-4oimage Try in Playground generateImage

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@Antipas/mcp-4oimage/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
